alert.note: Alert for Nacogdoches; Rusk; San Augustine; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 17 at 12:12PM CDT until March 21 at 8:12PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Attoyac Bayou Near Chireno affecting Shelby, Nacogdoches, San Augustine and Rusk Counties. For the Attoyac Bayou...including Chireno...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Attoyac Bayou Near Chireno. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Expect flooded paths and secondary roadways. Move livestock and equipment to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 12.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 15.3 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.7 feet on 04/07/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 1200 PM CDT.
